info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 11:59AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Catawba and northwestern Lincoln Counties through 1230 PM EDT... At 1159 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of Lincolnton, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hickory, Newton, St. Stephens, Conover, Maiden, Claremont, Catawba, Mountain View, Lake Hickory and Bandys. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Conditions are favorable for development of a very brief, weak tornado. Be prepared to take immediate action if a tornado is sighted or a Tornado Warning is issued.
